positive.review:
- If you like building and being creative, buy it! There are so many resources and styles to create with. 

- If you like exploration and adventure, buy it! The procedurally generated world offers new traps, landscapes, temples and dungeons each time you start a new game.

- If you like progression and boss fights, buy it! A lot of the huge leaps in progression are tied to boss fights and their are plenty of bosses and events to keep you entertained.

- If you like a challenge, buy it! There are plenty of game modes and difficulties to keep you on your toes, along with 'drunk seeds' that'll really shake your experience up.

For it's modest price there is so much do fight, build, explore and do. 

... It also has golf

Gameplay 10/10
It all starts with cutting down one tree, and ends with you challenging the edges of the universe. People call it "2D Minecraft"? That thought alone makes me laugh ‚Äì the depth of this game could wrap around Minecraft three times and still have room to spare.
Graphics 6/10
It's unapologetically 2D pixel art. But the Goblin Army's fireworks and the particle effects of the Stardust Dragon? Honestly, they absolutely slap.
Fun Factor 10/10
The long-term playability is insane. You can genuinely play this game until you retire.

Terraria is an endlessly charming sandbox that sucks you in faster than you expect. The mix of exploration, crafting, and increasingly chaotic boss fights makes every session feel fresh. I love how one moment I‚Äôm peacefully building a treehouse and the next I‚Äôm battling a giant floating eyeball. It‚Äôs quirky, addictive, and perfect for anyone who likes creativity with a side of chaos.

Definitely a Must, if you like Sandbox- and Survivalgames

[hr][/hr]
[h2]         ‚õèÔ∏è Terraria - Endless adventure ‚õèÔ∏è[/h2]
[hr][/hr]
Terraria is a 2D sandbox and open world survival game made and published by Re-Logic. Pointed out as the 2D Minecraft, it lets you do almost what you could imagine: build the whole map, fight tons of bosses, make farms, play co-op on a server with friends, play minigames, and let your creativity runs freely. It has a supported tModloader launcher with tons of mods made by the community. Is it something you can't truly do? 


[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2362282471" rel="noopener noreferrer]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2362282471[/url]¬†

[hr][/hr]
[h2]      ¬†           ‚úß Positive aspects ‚áÅ[/h2]
[hr][/hr]
The first time I played it, I got heavily surprised, and that cames because I was a Minecraft fan since early version, when I was an early teenager. I didn't play Terraria after longer and everyone since then threw to my mind it was a Minecraft, but in 2D. I was sceptic, and even if the game surprised me it wasn't a Minecraft, but I wasn't expecting to see some similarities with it in the sanbox terms. Althought this game it's other thing, the resemblances are there, but it has other focus in his core, and the amount of stuff you can do is limited due to being in 2D, but still let you a wide variety of options in the creative aspects. 


‚û¢ [i]Decent 2D pixelart.[/i] Not amazing, I saw way better and more detailed ones, so try to put this on a higher tier wouldn't be fair. Isn't bad either, just a middle term with some cool sprites and animations. Some mods enhance the art and make it look better, but I think the game would look weird with an over complex and detailed pixelart, so I think it was a right choice with the balance between simplicity and details.


‚û¢ [i]Iconic soundtrack[/i]. A variety of songs and melodies that will make you recognize the game whenever you hear it, from cachy rhythms to more frenetic songs during the bossfights.


‚û¢ [i]Huge amount of content[/i]. Between the vanilla including the mods provided by tModloader, it's a game to easily dig thousand of hours, specially with friends, and that will bring you joy over the years with his replayability. 


‚û¢ [i]Great bossfight designs[/i]. Good variety of bosses, events and equipment, and with the options to modify the terrain the strategies to defeat them become enormous. 


‚û¢ [i]Creativity freedom[/i]. To turn your whole world into whole ship, make a castle, turn everything into water or just tun the map into a void, the options are almost endless, without counting the modding. Perfect to let your creativity be free. 


[hr][/hr]
[h2]¬†     ¬†           ‚úß Negative aspects ‚áÅ[/h2]
[hr][/hr]
Even if I consider this game one of the greatest in the indie marketplace, whatever if it clicks with you or not, it has some stuff I don't like as much, or I think it would be better oriented or they should change. It's not that much, but perfection doesn't exist and you can always strive for something better, right?


‚û¢ [i]Not clear learning curvarture[/i]. I think anyone who play this game blindly, will get confused in what to do or where to go, even if you only have two directions in the beginning, but even when you start learning how, the jump between some bosses becomes harder than you could think, because it has some layers of knowledge you need to learn in order to face the bosses correctly, and it's something that might confuse a lot of beginners.


‚û¢ [i]Wiki-dependency[/i]. I'm not a fan when a game doesn't give you enough resources to know what to do, not hints, not anything, you need to discover everything by yourself so you ended up checking the Wiki because waste hours to find what you need to do, it's not fun at all. It should have a proper in-game wiki.


[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3598104307" rel="noopener noreferrer]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3598104307[/url]¬†
[hr][/hr]
[h2]¬†  ¬†            üèÜAchievement hunting ‚áÅ[/h2]
[hr][/hr]
Tedious and messy. Most of them are not hard at all, and there just a few quite challenging, but it's just a game that you will play hundred of hours in order to complete it, even going in the fast route will take you time, so be patience, check a guide and enjoy the game!


https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2797270308
[hr][/hr]
[h2]¬†  ¬†             ‚ñ´ ‚ó® ‚ñ™ FINAL THOUGHTS ‚ñ™ ‚óß ‚ñ´[/h2]
[hr][/hr]
As one of my favorite games I understand why it won't be a game for everyone. It's rough, confusing, the 2D view can be uncomfortable if you are not used to it, or it's just might not be the type of game of your liking, for me at least was a fresh and unique concept, even if it was just copying some core aspects from Minecraft, but doing their own recipe with it with an original touch. I spent hundred of hours on it, most of them out of Steam, whatever it was alone, with friends, with mods. I love almost every aspect of it, and I think it's a rounded game that people of a wide range of ages would love.


It's a game for sandbox lovers, people who love boss fighting, survival or a game with a potential building options to decorate your stuff, since it has a creative mode to spend alone countless of hours there building stuff. Do I recommend it? Hell yes, and it's cheap af, what it brings for what it cost it's just too good.

Terraria has great replayability features. I find myself coming back to this game on a regular basis as the progression feels rewarding and the gameplay is deep and fun. I have also logged somewhere around 200 hours on Switch.

The ability to reform the world and change biomes around is something I have always appreciated about this game. There are loads of ways to make cool and creative areas throughout your gameplay.

An excellent game.
One of the best sandbox progression whatever you can even call it games ever made. You can do so many cool things, the music is wonderful and the art is lovely and the vibes are immaculate.

The game of all time. So much content, wonderful art, simple yet difficult gameplay, OUTRAGEOUS replayability, Boss fights that will always get you're heart pounding, Very hot NPC (Zoologist), no trans propaganda (why does every game have gay flags everywhere???), cultured playerbase. 

A lot of people think the game is boring upon starting and playing a few minutes, but JUST GIVE IT TIME! the game feels sluggish and boring when you first start, but about when you kill the brain of chuthulu/eater of worlds, it starts getting to a point where it has an AMAZING gameplay loop. once you get to the point where you start killing the next boss, upgrading your gear, killing the next boss, googling a confusing crafting tree, upgrading your gear, it gets SO fun!! you just have to play this game. and don't say it sucks until you beat the wall of flesh. don't judge a book by its cover
very very fun game that you can spend lots of time of and never get bored of!
The game still gets updates 15 years later.... Would buy for $60.

It's Ight.





For Real Though. One of the best games period. I'm so glad the devs have had so much fun making this game. I have now as of writing this 1000 hours on pc alone, with another 1000 on consoles. I have been playing this game since launch on the Xbox 360 March 27th, 2013. Over 12 Years of amazing development. 14 different playthroughs and 3 more on the way. I cannot fathom how good this game is seriously try it. The one downside with the game is that it doesn't really guide you the best it can. Hopefully in 1.4.5 Re-Logic will guide the players better. Thank you Re-Logic for making a game you enjoy not a lot of companies do that anymore. Hope to see you in the future.

Terraria is pure adventure in a box. Endless worlds to explore, crazy bosses to fight, and secrets around every corner.
The crafting and building are insanely satisfying, and every playthrough feels fresh.
This game is a masterpiece of creativity and chaos ‚Äî I can lose hours and still want more.

If you are inclined to play a combination of Minecraft, Metroid, and a artwork devised by a madman, Terraria is just the game for you. It sports content for at least a decade, receiving free updates every couple years multiplying the content by 1.25. With a constant stream of community friendly patchs. I could not recommend it enough, especially at the soul crushing cost of $10. 




It also has developer support for mods as the Tmod loader.
Fun game to play by your self or with friends and if you ever get bored you can get mods which makes the game funnier.

Really good game and very funny with friends. In my opinion its better than minecraft and even better with mods. But remember: whatever you do DO NOT KILL THE GLOWING BUTTERFLY!!!!! (or do it if you wanna get one tapped) 10/10 game
this game is the second best occurance in all of man kind just behind the coming of Jesus

Okay, so for the past 2 years I've been putting off giving this game a try so much in fact I had 10 minutes until this week started then that all changed. Here are some things I should bring up, one is definitely be ready to dedicate plenty of time and effort into developing your person and character -much longer than the somewhat similar minecraft- along with a readiness to die in ways you never thought imaginable. Secondly, there are so many possibilities for ways to play and enjoy so be creative, make your pick. Finally, don't think that you beat a certain amount of bosses or collected a certain amount of items means you're done, there is almost always more things to do -unless you're a nerd who 100% the game completely- I've been having a very good time with this game and I'm about to go beat up a moon lord and make its flesh into weapons.

This game is in my top 3 games I've ever played, and with Terraria having mod support that makes it have so much more on top of the endless things you can do.
If I were to say this game is awesome it'd be a understatement.
Be ready to use the Terraria wiki if you're going to play this, because there's so much.

If Terraria were a breakfast cereal, it would be pure crystallized lightning flakes, served in a bowl forged from meteorite ore and filled with milk extracted from a celestial starbeast. This game didn‚Äôt just entertain me‚Äîit abducted me, strapped me to the hype engine, and launched me directly into a dimension where pixel art becomes religion and boss battles become rituals of cosmic dominance.

I came in thinking, ‚ÄúYeah, cute little sandbox game.‚Äù
50 hours later: I‚Äôm standing atop my player-built obsidian fortress, wearing armor that would make a demigod weep, screaming at the Moon Lord like I‚Äôm headlining a metal concert.

I have 112 out of 115 achievements, which means I‚Äôm basically a certified Terraria warlord, a pixelated prophet, a sandbox savant. Each achievement felt like injecting pure dopamine straight into my gaming soul. Farming rare drops? Adrenaline. Defeating bosses? Ecstasy. Accidentally blowing half my house up with dynamite? Peak entertainment.

The moment the soundtrack kicked in for the first boss, I swear something ancient awakened inside me. Every track in this game goes unnecessarily hard‚Äîlike "why is this 2D block game suddenly scoring my heroic life montage?"
Every biome? A vibe. Every enemy? A personal vendetta.
Every NPC? A roommate with incredibly questionable life choices.

Building?
Oh. My. God. BUILDING.
I set out to make a simple house. I ended up with an architectural abomination so glorious that Frank Lloyd Wright would rise from the grave just to high-five me.

Terraria is not just a game‚Äî
It‚Äôs a lifestyle,
a rite of passage,
a multiverse-sized adrenaline factory disguised as a cozy indie adventure.

And the best part?
I‚Äôve still got 3 achievements left.
Three tiny little boxes standing between me and TOTAL TERRARIA ASCENSION.
Once I complete them, I will become one with the Guide. I will speak in crafting recipes. My dreams will be structured in layers of dirt, stone, granite, and marble. I will transcend.

If you have even a single adventurous molecule in your body, get this game.
Board the hype train.
No‚Äîboard the HYPE STARSHIP, because Terraria isn‚Äôt taking you on a journey.

It‚Äôs taking you on an odyssey.
A screaming, glorious, boss-slaying, treasure-hoarding odyssey.

10/10. Would obliterate thousands of slimes again.

Just  Amazing this game. My first time playing the game was in my phone and finished it in expert mode. And when I got my PC I had to replay it but in master mode. And after finishing master mode I went to the mods.

Terraria is a great game for those who enjoy adventure and fun (Or endless suffering in Hardcore Mode).

10/10 game go buy it now!
the game is fun the dificulty is high for the most part the begining is a bit boring but its gets rely good after you get in hard mode.
this game is LIFE CHANGING. it may seem like a boring 2D game but HOLY MOLY ITS SO GOOD. my fav boss is empress of light :)
Thank you to the Terraria development team. Your game taught me how to search through a wiki and analyze information better than any class at school. Instead of playing, you taught me.

I love this game, pretty difficult to get into early game if you don't know what you're doing but once you get past the grindy part it is the most fun and in my opinion re-playable game I've ever played.

My friend mathew had sexual relations with this game for quite some time. He then brought those same sexual tendencies to me. I wish he would stop. Its everyday. I cant get a break. Its constant pounding and it hurts.

surement un des meilleurs jeux survies que j'ai jou√©. m√™me si le d√©but est un peu dur si vous suivez le wiki du jeu, vous arriverez √† la fin sans probl√®me

i think almost everyone knows about terraria. but ive played it for a long time back ps3 and ps4. its a classic. and here on steam being able to mod it with the workshop is absolutely insane. i love it. so many fun things to find. if you somehow never played terraria i cant recommend it enough. its packed with so much content

Terraria is a phenomenal game. Not only in the sheer volume of items, enemies, terrains, and events it contains, but in the near-perfect power scaling, fleshed-out decorating options, engaging and versatile combat, and fantastic music. Whether alone or with friends, there is something about this game that always holds my attention. It's equal parts demanding and laid-back, and its plethora of items are clearly designed with the gamer in mind. I cannot conjure a single negative impression, minor inconveniences aside. This game has always been, and still remains, a classic.
I love this game so effing much. I made my friend buy it. It's so beautiful. I cried. I laughed. I smiled. I felt anger and I felt... justice. So moving.
Played for 10 years this year. I have a lot of experience and a lot of memories, very nice game very good fun. Recommended to all gamers!

Big Fun. Use mods for even bigger fun!

But remember to drink water while playing.
Very fun game possibilities for mods 10/10 would play for hundreds more hours

‚ÄúTerraria ‚Äî A World of Endless Wonder‚Äù

Terraria is one of those rare games that feels both cozy and grand at the same time. From the first swing of your pickaxe to the final showdown with the Moon Lord, every moment is filled with discovery, creativity, and challenge. The world feels alive ‚Äî the way the sun rises over the forests, the biomes shift, and the enemies grow stronger as you explore further makes every adventure feel meaningful.

I love how the game balances freedom and progression. You can spend hours building a beautiful home, crafting intricate mechanisms, or exploring dangerous caverns full of treasures and secrets. Every boss fight feels earned, every new biome a reward for your curiosity. And the multiplayer? Sharing your adventures with friends makes every discovery even more memorable.

Terraria isn‚Äôt just a game; it‚Äôs a space to create, explore, and feel a sense of accomplishment. It has a kind of timeless magic ‚Äî one that keeps drawing me back, even years after I first started playing.

10/10 ‚Äî A beautifully crafted world that inspires creativity and adventure.
I grew up with Terraria, I started playing on mobile back in 2014 or so and it's been an absolute joy ever since
Impressive indie title, more fun with friends, though it needs a learning curve and a browser tab open but other than that it's fun to see yourself progress as you go on

Owned the game since launch, still play 14 years later. If I get tired of the base game (which is very hard to do with all the content it has), there are some fantastic quality, huge mods. Best 10 bucks I've ever spent.

2d minecraft and its good and always on sale for $5 the only problem with this game is i had every achievement and then they added like 15 more. also they keep saying theyre done with this game and then they update it even more and also you can mod this game yeah this game is awesome

A true classic, full of amazing content and rich game progression. Would absolutely recommend this to anyone who really enjoys the indie RPG genre, and loves to grind.
It's Terraria, if you haven't played this incredible game you should. There are lots of reasons why this game is both timeless and massively popular. Need I really say more at this point in time?

Absolutely one of the best games I've  ever played.   I'm always learn something new, and the updates are always amazing.  Every little element to build your world is worth doing to maximize your game play, whether it's the biome torches, statues, or banners, even armor, weapons, accessories, and the money you spend on reforges, it is bound to add to your level of enjoyment and sense of accomplishment.  You start with basic copper tools, and end up with a zenith and it will leave you beaming with the biggest sense of joy and pride at everything you did and all the dedication you poured in to win!!

I usually don't leave reviews on games but Terraria Hands Down my favorite game and one of the best games of all time. I have played this game since i was a kid, and i remember waiting desperately for the updates. this game is good because if you like minecraft you will like it. It is like 2d the boss fights are good I recommend this game. :D












Hi :D

My introduction to this game was through IRL friends and we would play this game together, It is a WAY easier experience this way.

However, no matter how you choose to play Terraria, make sure you have the Terraria Wiki on standby.

Fun game, bit long, unique weapons, fun references scattered within.

Random seeds make this game unique every playthough.

Different difficulties with different penalty severities.

Straight-forward progression once you read 10 articles on the Terraria wiki per item picked up.

one of the best games out there. if you are playing it for the first time and wanna use the wiki i recommend starting on expert mode. this made me look up all the different items there are and the best ways to get them. letting you experience every part of this game. some parts are a bit grindy or annoying but @ the end of the day still a banger game. and if you dont like something like for example npcs, crafting or item storage dont be afraid to look for a simple mod to fix it. tmod loader is your friend.

from my experience of game alone, i can see why mincraft would recommend something like this, not only are their alot of ways to play the game but their are also alot of cool secrets to discover, new wepon's, and most importantly 4 main sub classes, the melle, the summoner , the archer, and the magic user, terraria offers a HUGE verity on how you can play those 4 sub classes, not to mention your hard work after you beat the final boss is hella of amazing, the 4 main armors of terraria buffing your stats and improving your game play really comes a long way, not to mention it having one of the best swords in the game" THE ZENITH" since i love to play melle class that sword really took me a lil bit of time to get but in the end it was worth it and its hella powerful, 10/10 no matter what, if your bad at the game, JUST GET GOOD  any enjoy the game and actually do some side quest if your bored or if you wanna discover more                    d=====(Ôø£‚ñΩÔø£*)b                                        ‘Ö(¬ØÔπÉ¬Ø‘Ö)
Beautiful game, def in top 10 and would recommend to anyone who doesn't hate themselves
Very relaxing except for when fighting a boss just beat the game on expert mode cant wait to play calamity!

Terraria is a game that gives you what you put into it. You can rush through the story and "complete" the game, seeing a very superficial level of what it offers. You can also take your time, and explore the profound depths of game. This game rewards creativity and curiosity. It provides an enormous world with treasure and dangers on land, sea, the sky, underground, and even the Underworld. Crafting is intuitive and fun. Finding and crafting gear is an integral part of the game. Boss fights are another major aspect of the game. Bosses are unique and provide the right amount of challenge. It may take a couple of fights to overcome a boss, but the game never seems unfair or hopeless. Perhaps the most enjoyable aspect of the game is the sense of freedom it offers. Whether you want to craft an awesome sword, explore the most dangerous parts of the world, or simply fish - in Terraria, you can do it all.
I have been playing this game across every platform for years, I've grown up with this game and I can't recommend it enough.

I want to like this game, but I cannot enjoy it. While I am not looking for a game to hold my hand through it. This game does a terrible job of offering any guidance on "how" to do anything. Nearly half my playtime was the game paused while trying to find a video or guide for something.. so I figured why bother playing a game that can't offer basic advice.

Yes there is an NPC who will tell you to build a house to bring XYZ to you.. but it does nothing to explain about building, crafting, or mining. It is frustrating to spend the first 10+ hours trying to sort that out. Its turned me off from the game. 

There are games with similar mechanics that are more intuitive and fun then this. I can't recommend this game to anyone.

I want to love this game, but I don't. As an avid Stardew Valley enjoyer, this seemed appealing both visually and gameplay-wise, but the horrid start for new players drew me away completely. I don't really need a game that's going to hold my hand per se, but I would like somewhat of a tutorial beyond what the guide offers (cause damn he's so unhelpful that he's almost making my experience worse). I hope to give Terraria another chance one day in the future, and hopefully I'll come to understand why everyone is so fond of it. 

If you're pretty sure you'll enjoy Terraria, get it, but otherwise I would think on it for a bit.

If I could give a mid review I would.

Firstly, I want to preface this review by saying that this is my personal opinion as someone who wasn't particularly interested in playing Terraria until my friends forced me to. 

I think Terraria has a very pretty artstyle for the most part, especially the evironment, and I have to say the same about the music. I also actually like the early-game meelee combat, which feels very immersive and had me really trying to not get hit while also trying to land hits on the mobs.

However, to say the this game is hard to figure out would be an understatement. As a profound idiot myself, I found myself asking my friends for help on even the most mundane tasks like how to use the workbench. For the whole time I played I was walking around like a headless chicken, simply mining ores and dying brutally over and over while my friends seemed to just conjure up powerful items out of nothing. The whole time while I was walking around, despite getting more items, I felt like I was walking in circles, there was no real sense of progression. And to speak from my own experiences, playing with several people that all knew how to play left me mostly just picking up crumbs after them, never even getting a single Life Crystal despite spending most of my time underground, in part due to a lack of explanation for how to obtain them (I mostly blame my friends for this one).

And as a final note, while my overall opinion on the game was negative, I would like to point out that this review is as much a negative review of Terraria as it is of my friends.

The game forcing you to spend at least a couple hours stopping the spread of corruption, crimson was honestly enough to ruin the entire game for me. And not only that, after you enter hardmode you get more corruption, crimson. 

The controls are finicky and are often very annoying which can easily be enough to ruin any fun i had if it becomes a problem multiple times.

Building controls also suck and are annoying and finicky.

For me the negative overcame the positive so i would not recommend.

It's not horrible, but I mostly don't like it.
The problem for me is that there is nothing to do. You kinda expect that in a sandbox game, but here it feels more in the foreground. You get almost no progression from exploration. You can dig down for a really long time and find demonite ore. Which is super rare early game. But you can not even do much with it until you defeat the boss that also drops demonite. So why even explore?

And that's the game loop. All progress is tied to a line of bosses. And you don't naturally find/encounter those bosses (with a few exceptions). You look it up in the internet how to unlock them. And that kinda kills exploration. Just exploring doesn't give you anything and when you look up the boss it tells you where to go (there is a little exploration, but it is either go left/right until you encounter the biome x or dig down until depth x).

Same with crafting. It tells you what you can craft with the stuff you currently carry (and you can open one chest and then that counts too). You can not see what you could be crafting that you just lack the resources for. It does not tell you what you could already craft with the stuff you have in several chests. 
Again I do not find out what I can do in game. I look it up in a wiki and then collect the components from my many chests of stuff.

The way I play the game is build and gather resources and when I inevitably get too bored by nothing happening I look up how to get to the next boss. And then do that and the resulting building/crafting. Until I get too bored again.
I guess the "right" way to play the game would be to go straight for the boss train. But that would be an even worse game for me.
It just doesn't click for me.

How to beat terarria:
Search up the next boss because the game doesn't tell you.
Grind for what ungodly item summons it.
Grind for the new armor and weapon with slightly better stats. <- this is the longest step
repeat.

Combat in this game does the job but lacks depth. New item unlocks are often just rehashes of older items without new or interesting gimmicks. The game does a terrible job of telling you what to do next, so you have to search it up or play with someone who already knows.

This looks like a fun game, but there are some things I absolutely HATE and won't play the game because of it.

1. Everything is too small. I used the + icon to zoom in as much as possible but it's still too small. This is not a vision issue, I don't need glasses and see perfectly. It's just I like to play while sitting comfortably at a distance from my monitor. So even zoomed in I would have to squint to play the game. This is even more annoying for the inventory icons because the zoom is not applied to those icons. So I can't tell at all what the icons are and what I can build.

2. The night is too dark. This is also something I absolutely hate in games. I play during the day, with curtains open and lots of sunlight in the room. This makes it difficult to see what's happening on the screen if it's too dark. Even when playing in a dark room at night, it's still too dark. This game turns night into a game mechanic where you need torches to see anything. I hate when games do this. I want to play a game, not squint my eyes to see in the dark. 

I don't care how good the rest of the game is. These core issues make the game unplayable for me.

Minecraft Progression: 
Get 2 planks and 1 stick, wood sword.
Get 2 cobblestone and 1 stick, stone sword.
Get 2 iron and 1 stick, iron sword.
Get 2 gold 1 stick, gold sword.
Get 2 diamonds 1 stick, diamond sword.
Get 1 netherite ingot and an upgrade, Netherite sword. That's the best it gets. 
You can add enchantments to these items to make them better with books.

Terraria progression:
First, go to the NPC bingoth nigglestein, the poop salesman and get 200 lumps of rat feces. Then, go to the ocean, kill a whale to get it's penis. Then grind 20000 hours in caves to mine 20 emeralds and get to hell. Once in hell, you want to kill as many imps as you can with a wooden sword until one drops an imp-doo claw. Then, go to the banker NPC on Hanukkah, and if he is in a good mood, you can buy back your foreskin for 10,000 gold. Finally, go to the anvil and you will be able to craft the Rat shit sword (this is an early-game item and does 2 dps)
